title: U.S. Pledges $53 Million to Help Fix Ukraine’s Electrical Grid
description: American officials said they hoped the commitment would spur allies to make similar donations, as many Ukrainians head into winter without power or water.

title: Poland Wants Ukrainian Refugees to Pay Some Housing and Food Costs
description: Poland has taken in more Ukrainians fleeing the war than any other European country and by the end of the year, will have also spent more on services for them.

title: Your Wednesday Briefing: The U.S. Beats Iran
description: Plus China cracks down on protests and the U.S. pledges more aid to Ukraine.

title: Hurricane Season Ends, Marked by Quiet August and Deadly September
description: The six-month total of 14 named storms was about average. But two late-season hurricanes proved catastrophic in Florida and Puerto Rico.

title: Apartheid-Era Assassin in South Africa Is Stabbed Days Before Release Date
description: Janusz Walus, who killed the charismatic anti-apartheid leader Chris Hani, was stabbed just before he was due to be freed on parole, in a ruling that ignited anger in South Africa. He survived.

title: A ‘Bridge to the West’ Dies in Belarus, as Moscow Seeks More Help in Ukraine
description: Vladimir Makei, a former foreign minister who led failed efforts to improve relations with the West, died over the weekend. His death comes as Russia presses Belarus to send troops to Ukraine.

title: As Macron Pays State Visit to US, Ukraine Tests an Old Alliance
description: The French president goes to Washington with differences over how to end the war in Ukraine, and how to share its burdens, at the heart of talks with President Biden.

title: NATO ‘will not back down’ in its support for Ukraine, its secretary general says.
Israeli Filmmaker’s Critique of Popular Bollywood Film Draws Fierce Backlash
description: The filmmaker, Nadav Lapid, criticized “The Kashmir Files,” a Hindi-language film that depicts a violent chapter in the restive region of Indian-administered Jammu and Kashmir.

title: Trump’s Far-right Embrace
description: Why it’s important to know more about Nick Fuentes.

title: NATO Meets to Discuss Defense Aid to Sustain Ukraine Through Winter
description: The U.S. is planning an emergency cash injection for Ukraine to shore up its energy infrastructure after an onslaught of Russian attacks.

title: China Regroups to Snuff Out a Wave of Covid Protests
description: Officials are using the ruling Communist Party’s decades-old policy of repression and surveillance to quash the most widespread protests in decades. But Xi Jinping is silent.

title: China Protests Over ‘Zero Covid’ Follow Months of Economic Pain
description: President Xi Jinping’s unbending approach to the pandemic has hurt businesses and strangled growth, squeezing the world’s second-largest economy.

title: Proud, Scared and Conflicted. What the China Protesters Told Me.
description: In more than a dozen interviews, young people explained how the events of the past few days became what one called a “tipping point.”

title: One Step Closer to a Universal Flu Vaccine?
description: Scientist have tested in animals a vaccine that may protect against 20 strains of influenza, helping to prevent another pandemic.

title: Isabel dos Santos, Daughter of Angola’s Ex-President, Faces Arrest on Corruption Charges
description: Isabel dos Santos, the daughter of Angola’s former president, was accused of enriching herself with state resources during her time in control of the country’s oil company.

title: As Haiti Unravels, U.S. Officials Push to Send in an Armed Foreign Force
description: Fearing a mass exodus, some Biden officials are pressing for a multinational force, but they don’t want to send U.S. troops and haven’t been able to persuade other countries to take the lead.

title: Your Tuesday Briefing
description: Ukrainian military officials say Russia is planning more strikes on infrastructure.

title: Russian Retreat Reveals Signs of an Atrocity in a Ukrainian Village
description: In the southern Kherson region, the pattern seen in eastern Ukraine is repeating: The withdrawal of Russian forces yields evidence of possible war crimes.

title: China to Launch 3 Astronauts to New Space Station: How to Watch
description: The crew will set off from a secretive desert launch center to rendezvous with fellow astronauts aboard Tiangong, the country’s newly completed outpost in orbit.

title: Russia Postpones Nuclear Arms Meeting, US Officials Say
description: The treaty,  New START, calls for reciprocal inspections, but they have not been occurring, first because of the coronavirus pandemic, and now amid tensions over U.S. sanctions on Russia.

title: Ukraine Warns of More Strikes on Power Plants, as Russians Dig In
description: Russian forces are fortifying positions in southern Ukraine after retreating from Kherson, and the Kremlin denied planning to withdraw from the Zaporizhzhia nuclear plant.
